üöÄ Webflow Component System Setup Guide

This guide will help you integrate your enterprise component system with Webflow for seamless development and deployment.

Step 1: Your GitHub Repository is Already Set Up! ‚úÖ

Your component library is already hosted in your GitHub repository:

Repository: https://github.com/kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack
CDN URLs: https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack@main/dist/

Make sure your repository is public so the CDN can access the files.

Step 2: Create Webflow Project

Set up your Webflow project:

  1. Go to Webflow.com
  2. Click "New Project"
  3. Choose a blank project or template
  4. Name your project

Step 3: Configure Custom Code in Webflow

In your Webflow project settings, go to "Custom Code" and add the following:

Head Code (before </head>):

<!-- Tailwind CSS -->
<script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script>

<!-- Component System Styles -->
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack@main/dist/webflow-styles.css">

<!-- Font Awesome Pro -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack@main/dist/fontawesome-config.js"></script>

<!-- Component System -->
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack@main/dist/webflow-components.js"></script>
‚úÖ Ready to Use: The CDN URLs are already configured for your repository (kunalkatre21/eka-ai-stack).

Step 4: Configure Font Awesome Pro

To enable Font Awesome Pro icons:

  1. Get your Font Awesome Pro Kit ID from fontawesome.com/kits
  2. Edit the fontawesome-config.js file
  3. Replace YOUR_KIT_ID with your actual kit ID
  4. Commit and push the changes

Step 5: Add Components to Your Pages

Use HTML Embed elements in Webflow to add components:

Navigation Component:

<div data-component="navigation" data-config='{
"variant": "sticky",
"items": [
{"label": "Home", "href": "#home", "icon": "fal fa-home"},
{"label": "About", "href": "#about", "icon": "fal fa-user"},
{"label": "Services", "href": "#services", "icon": "fal fa-cog"},
{"label": "Contact", "href": "#contact", "icon": "fal fa-envelope"}
],
"logoIcon": "fad fa-hexagon-vertical-nft",
"showCTA": true
}'></div>

Hero Section Component:

<div data-component="hero-section" data-config='{
"title": "Welcome to Our Platform",
"subtitle": "Build amazing websites with our component system",
"badge": "New Feature",
"badgeIcon": "fad fa-sparkles",
"ctaText": "Get Started",
"ctaLink": "#contact"
}'></div>

Card Component:

<div data-component="card" data-config='{
"title": "Amazing Feature",
"content": "This feature helps you build better websites faster.",
"icon": "fad fa-rocket-launch",
"variant": "featured",
"badge": "Popular"
}'></div>

Glass Card Component:

<div data-component="glass-card" data-config='{
"title": "Glass Effect Card",
"content": "Beautiful glassmorphism effects with backdrop blur.",
"badge": "Premium",
"actions": {
"primary": "Learn More",
"secondary": "Contact Us"
}
}'></div>

Step 6: Using Webflow CMS Data

Connect components to Webflow CMS collections:

Dynamic Hero Section:

<div data-component="hero-section" data-config='{
"title": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"hero_title\\"} }}",
"subtitle": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"hero_subtitle\\"} }}",
"badge": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"hero_badge\\"} }}",
"ctaText": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"hero_cta_text\\"} }}"
}'></div>

CMS-Driven Cards:

<div data-component="card" data-config='{
"title": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"title\\"} }}",
"content": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"description\\"} }}",
"icon": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"icon\\"} }}",
"badge": "{{wf {\\"path\\":\\"category\\"} }}"
}'></div>

Step 7: Enable Debug Mode

Add this to your page's custom code to enable debugging:

<script>
// Enable debug mode
if (window.ComponentSystem) {
window.ComponentSystem.enableDebug();
console.log('Debug mode enabled');
}
</script>

üéâ You're All Set!

Your component system is now integrated with Webflow. You can:

  • Design visually in Webflow Designer
  • Add components using HTML Embed elements
  • Connect to Webflow CMS for dynamic content
  • Update components by pushing to GitHub
  • Use Font Awesome Pro icons

Troubleshooting

  • Components not loading: Check that all script URLs are correct and files exist on GitHub
  • Icons not showing: Verify your Font Awesome Pro Kit ID is configured
  • CMS data not working: Check Webflow field names match your component config
  • Styling issues: Ensure Tailwind CSS is loading before your custom styles

Next Steps

  1. Customize component styles in webflow-styles.css
  2. Add new components to webflow-components.js
  3. Set up automated deployment with GitHub Actions
  4. Create component documentation for your team
  5. Implement analytics tracking
